benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered: Valid Request coverage: Successful modifications with required headers and valid payloads (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12).
Edge cases covered: empty array (TC15), maximum lengths (TC16), extra properties ignored (TC17), mixed validity in payload (TC18), and duplicates (TC23).
Performance and scalability: large payloads (TC04, TC26), concurrency test scenario across accounts (TC25).

Resilience and error handling: missing/invalid headers (TC08), missing body (TC09), malformed JSON (TC10), invalid schema (TC11), unauthorized (TC12), server unavailable (TC13), dependency failure (TC14), timeout (TC19), transient network recovery (TC22).
Security and data validation: SQL injection (TC20), XSS (TC21).
Integration and compatibility: audit Logs (TC27), external reporting system (TC28), backward compatibility (TC24).
Accessibility: API documentation and error messages accessibility (TC29).
gaps: Partial Update semantics not explicitly tested (i.e., updating only some fields while leaving others untouched).
Concurrency on update conflicts for the same account (race condition) not explicitly tested.
Rate limiting / throttling behavior not tested.
Caching behavior headers (ETag, Cache-Control) not tested for PUT operations.
403 Forbidden scenarios (insufficient permissions) not explicitly tested (only 401Unauthorized).
Clarification/test coverage for 404 vs 400 on non-existent resource (account not found) could be reinforced.
Boundary testing for payload size around limits (411/413 handling beyond TC26) could be expanded.
recommendations: Add a Partial Update test to verify rejection or precise update semantics when only a subset of fields can be updated.
Introduce a test for same-resource concurrency/race conditions to detect update conflicts.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper handling under bursts.
Add tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) where applicable to PUT operations.
Add explicit 403 Forbidden tests to cover insufficient permissions scenarios in addition to 401 Unauthorized.
Add a test around 404 Not Found semantics for non-existent accounts (or confirm API contract prefers 400 as implemented).
Consider boundary tests around payload size near limits to confirm 413 behavior at the exact threshold.
